result.execSummary:
The defendant Allen D. Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 3rd Degree Sexual Assault, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs are paid.  Bond applied.  Balance of bond to be returned to poster.

The Defendant is to undergo any counseling the agent finds appropriate and must comply with any recommended treatment/assessment/counseling.  Defendant may not withdraw from any ordered program without permission of the agent and/or provider.  The Defendant is to obtain and maintain full time employment and/or educational programming as recommended.  The Defendant is to have no unsupervised contact with any children under 18 (including his own children) without  prior approval of Agent.  The Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - no alcohol or drugs unless prescribed by a physician.  The Defendant is subject to random drug/UA/breath testing.  The Defendant is not to go into any bars, taverns or businesses where the primary purpose is to sell alcohol.  Defendant is to comply with sex offender registry program, and undergo sex offender treatment.  Within 10 days of beginning probation, Defendant is to set up a scholarship fund for victim at $250 per month for every month of probation for victim's higher education.  If victim does not use the scholarship for a higher education, the money shall be returned to Defendant.  Payments to start 10/1/14, and be paid on the 1st of each month.  The Defendant is to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis.

timeConds.notes:
Lock up.
Imposed - Ten straight weekends in lock up from Friday at 10:00 pm until Monday at 10:00 am.  To begin sentence today.

Balance is Stayed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
